qas.question: Which groups can be categorized as Native Americans?

answers.text: people who lived in North America before European settlement

qas.question: When did the Native Americans lose their land?

answers.text: During the U.S. government's westward expansion

qas.question: Where were Native Americans forced to live after they lost their land?

In relation to whites, what was the poverty rate for Native Americans in 1990?

plausible_answers.text: people who lived in North America before European settlement

qas.question: Which groups can be categorized as Non-Native Americans?
When did the Native Americans win their land?

context: The category of Native American applies to the diverse group of <a0_0><b5_0>people who lived in North America before European settlement<b5_0/><a0_0/>. <a1_0>During the U.S. <b6_0>government's westward expansion<b6_0/><a1_0/>, Native Americans were displaced from their land which had been their home for centuries. Instead, they were forced onto <a2_0><b7_0>reservations<b7_0/><a2_0/> which were far smaller and less productive. According to Brest, land belonging to Native Americans was reduced from 138 million acres in 1887 to <a3_0><b8_0>52 million acres<b8_0/><a3_0/> in 1934. In 1990, the poverty rate for Native Americans was <a4_0>more than triple<a4_0/> that of the whites and only 9.4% of Native Americans have completed a bachelor's degree as opposed to 25.2% of whites and 12.2% of African Americans.
